title: editorial suggestions

editorial suggestions, adapt it to LEARN a little bit by

- create a bullet list for learning objectives
- smaller re arrangement of text
- bullet list to high list ML applications

title: editorial
body: the idea is to fill in the bullet lists a little more. I imagine the reader is helped by having a term explained upfront and then a meatier example below

title: changed structure
body:
- adjusted to look like concept units and exercises, some changes on what comes where
- imo, instruction and code should come very close, so changes on that

title: editorial changes
body:
Editorial changes

- changed a lot of h3 to h2
- structured exercise, like on LEARN

please make sure it reads correctly

title: editorial
body:
editorial fixes

- numbered steps
- adding h3s to make for an easier read
- add lead in sentences where needed

going to LEARN this feels like it needs a lot more explanation. I feel like I can follow the steps and get the same results, but I don't feel sure why I'm taking certain steps which leads to a feeling of doing a bunch of steps, but I'm not sure I can repeat them on another problem... 

but the charts that are there are good, helps a lot to verify that this seems to check out...

title: Fix discussion board link
body: Very cool course, thanks for sharing it! I noticed that if you click on the Discussion Board link from the README in GitHub, you get a 404. This PR changes the link to an absolute link, instead of a relative URL, which should fix the problem.

body: Usually while using jupyter notebooks\labs, it is advisable to use '!' before non python code (like pip). I thought we could also follow it here, it is just way to make code clearer and better. It doesn't disturb the functionality of the code. @jlooper is it okay ??? or can just close this PR. Sorry I made a mistake in last commit message :sweat_smile:

title: Add Turkish translation of the base README.md file
History of ML - French Translation
body:
Here is the translation of 1.2 History of ML in french.
The readme and the assignment have been translated accordingly to the vocabulary set in #186 .
As discussed, NLP has been kept in english.

It should solve two tasks in #166 .

I've checked it and it doesn't seem to have anymore mistakes. I've replaced some wikipedia links with their french equivalent when there was one.
